questions.question: This technique involves heating the soldering iron and applying it to the joint to melt the solder.
This term refers to the process of removing excess solder from a joint using a desoldering pump or wick.
This type of solder contains a core of flux, which helps to clean the joint and improve the flow of solder.
This technique involves heating both the component lead and the pad simultaneously to create a strong solder joint.
This term refers to the practice of using a soldering iron with a fine tip to work on small, delicate components.
